title.narrative: Civic Education

description.narrative: Civic Education: The funds will be used by the U.S. Embassys Public Affairs Section to continue a civic education project that was initiated in 2003 and has successfully promoted democratic values via community development at the local level in targeted areas, especially where religious groups are disconnected from the larger community. title.narrative: INL Interpretation services Pushi

description.narrative: INL Interpretation services_Pushi Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: Strengthening Government Capacity to Protect Victims of Trafficking in Albania

description.narrative: CRS is enhancing victim protection and conduct multi-disciplinary and multi-sectoral trainings on victim-centered investigations and prosecutions of trafficking cases in Albania. CRS is improving collaboration among government and civil society stakeholders to increase government capacity to (1) identify and refer victims of trafficking, and (2) conduct victim-centered investigations. In collaboration with the National Coordinator of the Office for Anti-Trafficking and local partner Caritas Albania, CRS is targeting Regional Anti-Trafficking Committees in four of the countrys 12 vulnerable districts and engage law enforcement and social services personnel to enhance protection efforts for victims of human trafficking.

title.narrative: Preventive Conservation of Archaeological and Ethnographic Objects at the Center of Albanian Studies in Tirana

description.narrative: To support preventive conservation of the archaeological collection at the Center of Albanian Studies in Tirana. This extensive collection consists of objects from more than 80 years of archaeological investigations in Albania but is currently housed in a building lacking proper environmental controls or security. This project includes work on the building infrastructure and the development of a conservation and maintenance plan.

title.narrative: Conservation of Historic Monuments in Kruj Damaged by the November 2019 Albania Earthquake

description.narrative: The 6.4 magnitude November 2019 Albania Earthquake killed 51 people, injured approximately 3,000, and caused an estimated $1.1 billion in damage. The earthquake damaged or destroyed more than 14,000 buildings, including historic fortifications and other national monuments in the earthquake zone. This project supports the post-earthquake conservation of Kruj Fortress and Tekke of Dolma.

title.narrative: Interpretation services for INL Mitrovasili

description.narrative: Interpretation services for INL _Mitrovasili Covers the cost of contracts for IT studies, plans, analysis, design and programming, and software maintenance, miscellaneous contractual services for informational technology, and contractual costs of IT systems operation and maintenance. Includes the expenses of contracts related to research and development, market research, maintaining and repairing computers and IT hardware and word processors. Covers the services from the Public Buildings Administration, facility operation, continuing medical education for Peace Corps, security guard services, leasing armored vehicles, Police/Military Guards furnished by host country, post language training, market development agreements, services/supplies/equipment used with physicians/medical staff, and contractual services for immunizations. Also include miscellaneous travel related expensed paid on travel vouchers, contractual services for educators/translators/course instructors, furnishing own supplies, and tuition for training sponsored by FSI, meals/rooms/expenses for offsite FSI trainings.

title.narrative: Conservation of Historic Monuments in Durres Damaged by the November 2019 Albania Earthquake

description.narrative: The 6.4 magnitude November 2019 Albania Earthquake killed 51 people, injured approximately 3,000, and caused an estimated $1.1 billion in damage. The earthquake damaged or destroyed more than 14,000 buildings, including historic fortifications and other national monuments in the earthquake zone. This project supports the post-earthquake conservation of Durrs Fortress.

title.narrative: Preservation of Five Post-Byzantine (16th-19th Century) Monasteries in the Drino Valley

description.narrative: The churches and monasteries of the Drino Valley stand testament to the rich cultural heritage of Albania and the western Balkans from late Antiquity to the post-Byzantine era. Drawing from the survey of registered cultural monuments of Christianity produced during previous AFCP grants (2014 and 2019), this project involves the conservation of five monasteries and the development of a community-focused cultural route for tourists.

Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Civic Education

description.narrative: Civic Education: The funds will be used by the U.S. Embassys Public Affairs Section to continue a civic education project that was initiated in 2003 and has successfully promoted democratic values via community development at the local level in targeted areas, especially where religious groups are disconnected from the larger community. The project will continue to engage key audiences through civic education curricula, networks of faith-based institutions, and joint projects that improve the entire community.

title.narrative: Conservation of Historic Monuments in Prez Damaged by the November 2019 Albania Earthquake

description.narrative: The 6.4 magnitude November 2019 Albania Earthquake killed 51 people, injured approximately 3,000, and caused an estimated $1.1 billion in damage. The earthquake damaged or destroyed more than 14,000 buildings, including historic fortifications and other national monuments in the earthquake zone. This project supports the post-earthquake conservation of Prez Fortress.

title.narrative: Democracy Commission Small Grants Program

description.narrative: Democracy Commission Small Grants Program: The U.S. Embassys Democracy Commission gives small grants primarily to local non-governmental organizations (NGOs) engaged in building social and intellectual foundations of democracy, democratic resolution of problems and institutionalization of open, pluralistic political processes. All proposals are given a technical review and approval in Washington, D.C., prior to a grant being issued by the Embassy.

title.narrative: Conservation of Historic Monuments in Kruje Damaged by the November 2019 Albania Earthquake, Analysis and Treatment of Bedrock

description.narrative: In the process of stabilizing and restoring the clock tower at Kruje Fortress following the November 2019 Albania, Earthquake, the project team discovered fractures in the bedrock beneath the tower foundations. This project involves the investigation of the fracutures in depth and the development of a detailed intervention approach for strengthening the rock beneath the tower.

Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Strengthening Albanias efforts towards an effective and sustainable response to trafficking in persons (TIP)

description.narrative: IOM aims to strengthen Albanias response to trafficking, with a primary focus on protection and secondary focus on prosecution. Trainings will be provided on effective responses to trafficking for law enforcement and the judiciary, as well as victim identification and referral at the local level for health care practitioners, state labor inspectors, private travel operators and regional anti-trafficking committees. IOM will also pilot three mobile units for victim identification in cooperation with a local coalition, and assist shelters in sustaining victim reintegration.

description.narrative: AMBER Alert Covers grants (including revenue- sharing), subsidies, gratuities, and other aid for which cash payments are made to states, other political subdivisions, corporations, associations, and individuals; contributions to international societies, commissions, proceedings, or projects, whether in lump sum or as quotas of expenses; contributions fixed by treaty; grants to foreign countries; taxes imposed by taxing authorities where the Federal Government has consented to taxation (excluding the employers share of Federal Insurance Contribution Act taxes); and payments in lieu of taxes.
